title: Code-to-spec conformance audit
description: Compare Uniswap v2 Solidity implementation against TLA+ specs from uni2-spec01. For each TLA+ action (swap, mint, burn), verify the code enforces the specified invariants and state transitions. Flag where code behavior diverges from spec: missing guards, unchecked edge cases (zero amounts, self-swaps, rounding), or state transitions the spec doesn't model. Run Slither and CodeQL to support findings with concrete code paths. Output to hooks/protocol-context/findings/code-spec-audit.md

title: Cross-correlate all findings
description: Merge outputs from spec model checking (uni2-spec01), static analysis (uni2-code01), and doc audit (uni2-doc01). Identify bugs where a TLA+ counterexample maps to a real code path, or where a Slither finding confirms a doc/spec gap. Rank by exploitability. Output to hooks/protocol-context/findings/correlated-findings.md

title: Two-way doc/spec correlation audit
description: Compare protocol documentation (whitepaper + docs site) against TLA+ specs. Flag where docs promise behavior the spec doesn't capture, and where the spec has invariants the docs don't mention. Classify severity: CRITICAL if docs promise a safety property not in spec, MEDIUM if spec models undocumented assumptions. Output to hooks/protocol-context/findings/doc-audit-report.md

title: Write exploit PoCs for confirmed bugs
description: For each CRITICAL/HIGH finding from uni2-corr01, write a Foundry test case demonstrating the exploit against a mainnet fork. PoCs go in hooks/protocol-context/pocs/. Only work on findings that have been confirmed by cross-correlation â€” no speculative exploits.

title: Write TLA+ specs for UniswapV2Pair
description: Formalize swap(), mint(), burn() as TLA+ actions. Model constant product invariant (x*y=k minus fees), LP share proportionality, and flash swap atomicity. Output specs to hooks/protocol-context/specs/
